title: Investment Funds Update - Europe: Legal and regulatory updates for the funds industry from the key asset management centres and primary European fund domiciles: UK

e led by HM Treasury and the FCA and will include an expert advisory panel of 12 to 15 senior figures representing financial services providers, financial advisors and consumer representatives. 
"Statement on the Financial Advice Market Review". 
and included a number of unexpected tax proposals affecting the UK asset management industry, including proposed changes to the taxation of carried interest and performance related returns. 
"The UK Summer Budget - Private Equity and Investment Management". 
' oversight and controls relating to financial benchmarks carried out between August 2014 and June 2015. 
"TR15/11: Financial Benchmarks: Thematic Review of Oversight and Controls" . 
"non-EU AIFs" for the purposes of the AIFMD by virtue of being authorised in Jersey by the Jersey Financial Services Commission. 
"Alternative Investment Funds (Amendment of Regulations No. 2) Order 2015". 
“registered office”, should use its principal place of business to determine the place where the AIF is established, with the consequence that an English limited partnership with a principal place of business in Jersey would be considered a non-EEA AIF. The position of Scottish limited partnerships is not specifically considered in this draft guidance. The consultation closed in May 2015 but no final rules have yet been published.
